div.p: Most illustrious man, I finally send something that I was able to fish out from the Tridentine synagogue, certainly not without great labors, expenses, and dangers. The one who sends this writes to me thus: "I hear that they have not only discussed the Eucharist but have even completed it; I will send the decree shortly." And I will send everything to you immediately. Give these to my nephews, indeed help them, so that they have someone to transcribe them; for I have ordered that two copies be sent to other brothers. Farewell and greetings to you with the whole family, school, and church. Vicosoprano, November 10, 1551.
To the most illustrious Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, pastor of the Zürich church. In Zürich.
